intro: Ainsliaea angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Ainsliaea angustata is often found in the understory of forests, where it thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil.
